page.title: 14CHARLTON-HANK.ECOLOGY 4
page.content: {FAUNA:}SMALL PONDS SUPPORT COMMON FROGS,TOADS AND THREE SPECIES OF NEWTS,GRASS SNAKES,ADDERS,SLOWWORMS AND COMMON LIZARDS OCCUR.FIELD VOLES, LONG TAILED FIELD MICE AND RABBITS ARE PREYED UPON BY WEASELS,STOATS AND FOXES.THERE ARE GREY SQUIRREL DREYS AND BADGER SETTS.BATS INCLUDE BROWN LONG EARED AND PIPISTRELLES. {DRAGONFLIES}ARE A FEATURE OF THE PONDS AND STREAMS. THERE ARE GOOD NUMBERS OF {BUTTERFLIES}AND MOTHS. THE SILVER SPOTTED,LARGE AND SMALL SKIPPERS OCCUR. SMALL AND LARGE WHITES, SMALL HEATHS,WALL BROWNS, SPECKLED WOODS, GATEKEEPERS,MEADOW BROWN,ORANGE TIPS ARE IN THE FIELDS. IN GARDENS SMALL TORTOISESHELLS,COMMAS, RED ADMIRALS, PEACOCKS,SMALL COPPERS AND PAINTED LADIES ARE COMMON.
